intro: Reseda propinqua, commonly known as the narrow-leaved reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Reseda propinqua is often found in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
